description: Try our easy to follow Choc-Cherry Crepe Cake recipe. Absolutely delicious with the best ingredients from Woolworths.
keywords: Cake,Pescatarian,Seafood free,Low salt,Tree nut free,Sesame free,Cherry,Christmas,Soy free,Vegetarian,Peanut free
name: Choc-Cherry Crepe Cake Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 3.5 cup milk (Save 2 cups milk for custard)
3 tbs icing sugar (Save 2 tbs for dusting)
3 tsp vanilla extract (Save 2 tsp vanilla extract for later)

recipeInstructions.text: To make crepes, process flour, cocoa and icing sugar in a food processor until combined. Whisk eggs and milk together in a jug. With motor running, gradually add egg mixture to flour mixture. Process until smooth. Transfer to a bowl and stir in butter. Set aside for 15 minutes.

Heat a 22cm crepe pan or large frying pan over medium heat. Grease the pan with a little butter, wiping out excess. Ladle and quickly swirl to evenly cover base. Cook for 2 minutes or until edges are set. Carefully lift the edge and, if underneath is golden, flip crepe over. Cook for 1 minute, then slide onto a plate. Repeat until all the batter is used (you should have 12-15 crepes).

To make custard, place milk in a saucepan and heat to just below boiling point. Remove from heat. whisk eggs and sugar together in a bowl. Gradually whisk in milk and return to a clean pan. Mix cornflour with a little water until smooth. Stir into milk mixture with vanilla, then stir over medium heat until mixture boils and thickens.

Remove from heat and cover surface with plastic wrap to prevent a skin forming. Cool completely. To make filling, reserve a few cherries with stems for decorating. Pit and roughly chop the rest. Place in a bowl with sugar and vanilla. Combine and set aside for 15 minutes.

To assemble, line the base of a springform pan with baking paper. Place a crepe into the pan, spread with a little custard, then top with another crepe and mixture. Repeat layering. Cover and chill for 30 minutes. To serve, transfer to a cake plate. Top with remaining custard, reserved cherries and dust with icing sugar.
